body_html:
I think Zenodo is still not considered as a publication in academic citation databases (ISI, Scopus, Google Scholar), so I would encourage authors to always cite the academic publication if possible. Regarding versions, since all PyTorch versions are available from GitHub, I also think that linking to the version on Zenodo is not really necessary in this case. E.g., one could cite it as
"... we used PyTorch v0.3 (Paszke et al) to implement x."

body:
I think Zenodo is still not considered as a publication in academic citation databases (ISI, Scopus, Google Scholar), so I would encourage authors to always cite the academic publication if possible. Regarding versions, since all PyTorch versions are available from GitHub, I also think that linking to the version on Zenodo is not really necessary in this case. E.g., one could cite it as
"... we used PyTorch v0.3 (Paszke et al) to implement x."
